title: This LEGO Paddington Bear Set Is So Charming, You’ll Want a Marmalade Sandwich

text: Somewhere in the heart of London, on a quiet street lined with neatly kept townhouses, lives a small bear with a love for marmalade and a talent for finding trouble. Paddington has charmed generations, from the pages of Michael Bond’s books to the stop-motion magic of the 1970s cartoon and the warmth of the 2014 live-action film. Now, he’s found a new home—one built brick by brick, capturing his world with the unmistakable charm of LEGO. This fan-designed LEGO Paddington set brings the popular book and show to life, recreating a portion of Paddington station with impressive detail. The MOC features an ornate section of the station with Paddington mid-adventure, sandwich in his hand, and suitcase at his side. The architecture balances simplicity with authenticity, using clever brickwork to mimic the charmingly old-fashioned London aesthetic. Designer: Bricked1980 The blast from the past (more so for British fans) honors the series wonderfully with a 1300 brick construction. It stands at an impressive 30 centimeters (12 inches) tall, capturing the first glimpse we get of our favorite Marmalade-eating bear arriving at Paddington in search for a home and a loving family. A LEGO Paddington wouldn’t be complete without the bear himself, and this minifigure version is as charming as you’d hope. His red hat and blue duffle coat are recreated with printed details, capturing the look that has made him so instantly recognizable. A small suitcase—likely packed with a marmalade sandwich for emergencies—rounds out the figure, making him ready for any adventure. Other details include pigeons, two streetlamps, and the Paddington sign seen at the station. Peer in and you’ll notice all the smaller details that make this build so captivating. A note on Paddington the Bear says “Please look after this bear, thank you”, while the suitcase comes with stickers from all of the bear’s past destinations. You’ll notice a marmalade sandwich in the bear’s hand, and just in case that doesn’t satiate it, there’s one more kept away on the side, right beside a jar of marmalade! For LEGO fans, this build strikes a perfect balance between nostalgia and design. The details make it a rewarding project, while the Paddington figure is surprisingly lifelike by LEGO standards. The build’s truly a love letter to Paddington’s world, designed with the same warmth and humor that has made his stories endure for decades. Whether displayed on a shelf or gifted to a loved one, this set celebrates the bear who reminds everyone that kindness (and a good sandwich) can make any place feel like home. For enthusiasts, the LEGO Ideas Paddington The Bear set is currently gathering votes on the LEGO Ideas forum. With a staff-pick badge and well over 2,500 votes in the bag already, it’s gradually making its way to the top of the site. You can vote for the build on the LEGO Ideas website here.
